== Main Inclusion Report for sexy-python ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' Is available for all supported archs (i386, powerpc, sparc and amd64)
# ''Rationale:''
** In the future a build dependency of gnome-app-install. In my local branch I already implemented an advanced search entry that is based on sexy.IconEntry
** Libsexy is already in main and used by Rhythmbox
 0. ''Security:''
** Quite low tech
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Is maintained by Christian Hammond (ChipX86), a known memember of the GNOME community, who is also the maintainer of libsexy
** There are no known major bugs: http://bugzilla.gnome.org/browse.cgi?product=libsexy
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** Seems to follow the Debian Python Policy and FHS
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** All dependencies are already in main (mainly pygtk and libsexy)
 0. ''Background information:''
** None

=== Reviewers ===
MartinPitt: easy enough, just Python bindings to an existing library. Approved.
